result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

State objects
Court: The previous Cash Bond was forfeited so now he needs another

Prepared by Christina M.H. Engen, PhD
Compass
for Examination under 971.16 (NG by reason of mental disease/defect) - signed by GLD

11:26 am     Def in court w/ Atty Gregg Earl Waterman.  Def in custody.  John William Kellis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Prelim waiver filed - signed/understands.  No promises/threats.
COURT finds the waiver of the PH is K, V & I made.  Probable cause found - Bound over for trial.
Information filed - Reading waived.  Def Pleads NG and NG by reason of mental defect - NG Pleas entered.
PTC:  2/26 at 2:30 pm    STC:  3/17 at 10 am   GLD
Waterman asks the Court appoint a psychologist or psychiatrist to examine Mr. Neas
COURT will appoint an examiner.  Barton will prepare the order.
Waterman argues for a sig. bond.  Court sites JSS violations.  Numerous charges.
$500 cash bond.  No controlled substances w/o an RX.  No driving unless reinstated.  JSS drug testing and GPS for house arrest.  (covers both files)
Gregg Waterman

11 am Def in court w/ Atty Michael John Colgan.  Def in custody.  John William Kellis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
No attorney appointed yet.  Mr. Neas states he spoke to Mike Colgan.  He represented me before.
PH:  1/28 at 11 am    GLD
Mr. Neas asks about bond.  Kellis sites several JJS violations.  Court addresses Mr. Neas about complying with bond.
Bonds to continue.
Justice Sanctions Violations notice, filed. SLH - note and file.
OTD signed SLH & issued in 15CF856

10:58 am - Defendant Robert W Neas not in court.  Emily Hynek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
SPD hasn't found counsel for defendant. 
Court finds good cause to go beyond time limits. 
PH: 1/21/16 @ 11am (GLD)

Def in custody w/Atty O'Neil
$200 cash bond req w/same cond
PH: 1/13 @ 11 (SLH)
